intro: Neodissochaeta sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak hairgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Malaysian state of Sarawak. This grass is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
